channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: WPPのGroupM、グローバルCEOにマディソン・アベニューのベテランで、メディア投資の上級管理職を経験したブライアン・レッサーを指名（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
WPP's GroupM names Brian Lesser, a veteran Madison Avenue operative who has worked in senior media investment roles on both sides of the table, as global CEO  —  Brian Lesser, a veteran Madison Avenue operative who has worked in senior media-investment roles on both sides of the table …

item.title: ピュブリシス、2024年上半期の売上高は前年同期比7.7%増の77億ユーロ、2024年の売上高成長率ガイダンスを4%～5%から5%～6%に引き上げ。
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
Publicis reports H1 2024 revenue up 7.7% YoY to €7.7B and raises revenue growth guidance from 4%-5% to 5%-6% for 2024, as US tech clients' ad spending picks up  —  Paris-based advertising agency nudges up annual forecast on recovery in marketing budgets

item.title: 情報筋WBD、CNNを含むレガシーTVネットワークからストリーミングとスタジオ事業を分離することを検討中。
item.description:
Financial Times:
Sources: WBD weighs splitting off its streaming and studio businesses from its legacy TV networks including CNN, leaving most of its debt with the TV networks  —  Group behind CNN and HBO has discussed options including spin-off of its streaming service and movie studio

item.title: ニュースメディアは、技術革新が存在しない場所に閉じ込められているようだ。おそらく、実験することのリスクか、トップダウンの文化のせいだろう（Ben Werdmuller/Werd I/O）。
item.description:
Ben Werdmuller / Werd I/O:
The news media seems to be trapped in a place where technical innovation is nonexistent, perhaps due to the risks of experimentation or due to top-down culture  —  If you're waiting for permission to build something, or if you want to see how well something has worked for your peers …

item.title: 米証券取引委員会（SEC）、DWACのパトリック・オーランド前CEOを提訴 トランプ氏のソーシャルメディア企業とのSPAC合併計画について投資家を欺いた疑い（ブルームバーグ
item.description:
Bloomberg:
The US SEC sues former DWAC CEO Patrick Orlando for allegedly misleading investors about his company's plans for a SPAC merger with Trump's social media company  —  - Patrick Orlando eyed Trump Media before IPO, SEC claim  — SEC settled with DWAC for $18 million over similar issue

item.title: Apple NewsとTaboolaの契約は衝撃的で、ブランドを逸脱しており、プライバシーを含む優れた顧客体験に対するアップルのコミットメントに疑問を投げかけるものだ（Om Malik/On my Om）
item.description:
Om Malik / On my Om:
The Apple News deal with Taboola is shocking and off-brand, calling into question Apple's commitment to good customer experience, including privacy  —  I've been a happy Apple One customer.  It made perfect sense signing up for the package considering I was paying for Apple TV+, Apple Music and iCloud storage.

item.title: エミー賞ノミネート数：Netflixが107でトップ、FXが93、HBO/Maxが91、Apple TV+が72、ABCとCBSがそれぞれ38、Prime Videoが37、Huluが26、Disney+が19（Peter White/Deadline）
item.description:
Peter White / Deadline:
Emmy nominations numbers: Netflix took the top spot with 107; FX had 93, HBO/Max 91, Apple TV+ 72, ABC and CBS 38 each, Prime Video 37, Hulu 26, and Disney+ 19  —  The revolving door of Emmy nominations leader continues to swing.  —  Netflix has taken top spot with the most Emmy nominations …

item.title: 情報源：WNBAのメディア放映権契約はNBAのものと同じで、リーグは11年間で少なくとも22億ドル、現在の〜5000万ドル/年から2億ドル/年を得ることになっている（Mike Vorkunov/New York Times）。
item.description:
Mike Vorkunov / New York Times:
Sources: the WNBA's media rights deals mirror the NBA's, and the league is set to get at least $2.2B over 11 years or $200M/year, up from the current ~$50M/year  —  The WNBA's next national media rights package has come into shape.  The league is set to receive roughly $2.2 billion …

item.title: スポティファイ、英語DJが利用可能な市場で、スペイン語とラテンアメリカと並んでスペイン語を話すAI DJのベータ版をプレミアムユーザー向けに開始（Jess Weatherbed/The Verge）
item.description:
Jess Weatherbed / The Verge:
Spotify launches an AI DJ that speaks Spanish in beta for Premium users in markets where its English-language DJ is available, alongside Spain and Latin America  —  The new Spanish-language voice has been provided by Spotify's senior music editor, Olivia “Livi” Quiroz Roa …

item.title: 英国の判事が、調査報道局とフリージャーナリストの申請を受けて、性犯罪者の名前を公表することを認める判決を下した（Hannah Summers/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Hannah Summers / The Guardian:
A UK judge rules that a sex offender's name can be published following an application by the Bureau of Investigative Journalism and a freelance journalist  —  Bureau of Investigative Journalism applied to name father who wanted to have unsupervised contact with his child

item.title: ソースPE企業CVCキャピタル・パートナーズは、新聞グループ競売の第一ラウンドの期限を今週に控え、テレグラフ紙への入札を検討している（Mark Sweney/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Mark Sweney / The Guardian:
Source: PE firm CVC Capital Partners is considering a bid for the Telegraph, ahead of a deadline for the first round of auction of the newspaper group this week  —  Potential bid by CVC Capital Partners believed to be structured to back newspaper group's management team

item.title: メタ社は、一部の研究者がインスタグラムのデータに最大約半年間アクセスし、アプリが10代や若年層に与える影響を研究するための小規模なパイロットプログラムを開始した（Caroline Mimbs Nyce/The Atlantic）。
item.description:
Caroline Mimbs Nyce / The Atlantic:
Meta launches a small pilot program to let some researchers access Instagram data for up to about six months to study the app's effect on teens and young adults  —  Meta, infamous for kicking researchers off its platform, flirts with slightly more transparency.  —  The teens are on Instagram.

item.title: スペイン、欧州メディア自由法に沿ってフェイクニュースに取り組むメディア規制強化を提案、保守系野党は批判的メディアを検閲する規則だと主張（Inti Landauro/Reuters）
item.description:
Inti Landauro / Reuters:
Spain proposes tighter media rules to tackle fake news in line with the European Media Freedom Act; conservative opposition say the rules censor critical media  —  Spain announced measures on Wednesday designed to curb the spread of fake news, an initiative blasted by the country's conservative opposition …

item.title: MSNBCの幹部セザール・コンデとラシダ・ジョーンズが、トランプ氏を "甘やかし"、トランプ氏が選挙に勝利した場合の緊張を避けるためにモーニング・ジョーの放送を取りやめたとMSNBC関係者が非難（Natalie Korach/The Wrap）
item.description:
Natalie Korach / The Wrap:
MSNBC insiders accuse executives Cesar Conde and Rashida Jones of pulling Morning Joe off the air to “coddle” Trump and avoid tensions if he wins the election  —  Tension skyrocketed at MSNBC this week as network news insiders accused NBCU News Group Chairman Cesar Conde …

item.title: BBCのiPlayerとビデオの製品責任者アンキット・クマールが退社、関係者によると突然の退社で、製品チームは重役の退社で「激動の時」を迎えている（Jake Kanter/Deadline）
item.description:
Jake Kanter / Deadline:
BBC Head of Product for iPlayer and Video Ankit Kumar leaves; a source says he left abruptly, and the product team is having a “turbulent time” as execs leave  —  Ankit Kumar joined the BBC in October 2022 from Amazon and played a key role in making iPlayer a destination for more than 17M British viewers every week.
